result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Review hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

INCLUDES 20CT225 & 22CF977: No contact with victim(s): Ara Nails, T.D.A.T., M.T.N. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:09 pm.
INCLUDES: 20CT225 and 22CF977.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears from MCJ and with Attorney Fontana. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $1500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  Ara Nails, T.D.A.T, M.T.N. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
